title: Panic when improperly ignoring stainless test
body:
I'm new to using the stainless plugin for my tests. While writing them, I ignored one the wrong way (using the `#[ignore]` annotation), and caused a rustc panic.

I reduced my code to a MWE:

I tried this code:

**Cargo.toml:**

```
[package]
name = "rustc-panic"
version = "0.1.0"
authors = ["Austin Glaser <austin.glaser@gmail.com>"]

[dependencies]

[dev-dependencies]
stainless = "*"
```

**src/lib.rs:**

```
#![feature(plugin)]
#![cfg_attr(test, plugin(stainless))]

#[cfg(test)]
describe! a_thing {
    #[ignore]
    it "should be ignored" {
        assert!(false);
    }   
}
```

I expected to see this happen: A compiler error, complaining about my bogus syntax
